clusters.title: Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10, as other regions hit too
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian Attacks on Kyiv Kill Four, Injure Dozens

items.title: Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10, as other regions hit too
Russian drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills at least 4
items.standfirst: This is the first major bombardment since an air attack in August on Kyiv left at least 21 people dead.
items.content: This is the first major bombardment since an air attack in August on Kyiv left at least 21 people dead.

items.title: Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘vile and cowardly’ 12-hour bombing of Ukraine
items.standfirst: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine: Massive Russian missile and drone barrage kills at least four in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.
items.content: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.

items.title: Heavy Russian drone attack kills at least four in Ukraine’s capital Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.
items.content: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.

items.title: 'Hundreds' of drones and missiles fired at Ukraine by Russia
items.standfirst: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.
items.content: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

items.title: Ukraine: Kyiv hit by massive Russian drone and missile attack
items.standfirst: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.
items.content: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.

items.title: Russian missiles and drones pound Ukraine in ‘savage’ 12-hour attack
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles

items.title: Russia launches deadly aerial attack on Ukraine as Poland scrambles jets
items.standfirst: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.
items.content: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.

items.title: Russia launches massive attack on Kyiv - as Poland scrambles jets and closes airspace
items.standfirst: Russia has launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine's capital this morning, killing four people and injuring about 10, Kyiv's military administration has said.
items.content: Russia has launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine's capital this morning, killing four people and injuring about 10, Kyiv's military administration has said.

ai_summary: Russian drone and missile attacks on Kyiv killed at least four people.
The attacks were some of the worst bombardments since the invasion began.
Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles over a 12-hour period.
Attacks targeted Kyiv and other regions, including Zaporizhzhia and Odesa.
President Zelenskyy condemned the attacks as "vile and cowardly".

items.title: At least two dead in shooting and fire at Mormon church in Michigan

Security experts suggest the suspect used tactics to maximize damage.

clusters.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams drops out of mayoral race
clusters.neutral_headline: New York City Mayor Eric Adams Drops Out of Reelection Bid

items.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams drops out of mayoral race
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced that he is dropping his third-party bid for re-election, narrowing the field for November’s election.
items.content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced that he is dropping his third-party bid for re-election, narrowing the field for November’s election.

items.title: New York Mayor Eric Adams abandons reelection campaign
items.standfirst: New York Mayor Eric Adams said Sunday he would drop his reelection bid after losing ground to Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani, a self-described socialist. Adams, 65, once popular, was weakened by corruption probes and criticism over his cooperation with Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.
items.content: New York Mayor Eric Adams said Sunday he would drop his reelection bid after losing ground to Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani, a self-described socialist. Adams, 65, once popular, was weakened by corruption probes and criticism over his cooperation with Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...
items.content: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...

items.title: Eric Adams says he is dropping out of New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: Adams bows out, leaving the race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
items.content: Adams bows out, leaving the race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.

ai_summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams withdrew his bid for reelection.
The withdrawal sets up a three-way race for the November election.
Adams cited sagging poll numbers and pressure from leaders.
Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo will now face off.
Adams was weakened by corruption probes and criticism.

clusters.title: Pro-EU party in Moldova set to win election mired in claims of interference
clusters.neutral_headline: Moldova's Pro-EU Party Leads in Parliamentary Election

items.title: Pro-EU party in Moldova set to win election mired in claims of interference
items.standfirst: The vote was seen as critical for Moldova's EU path, and President Maia Sandu warned the country's future was in danger.
items.content: The vote was seen as critical for Moldova's EU path, and President Maia Sandu warned the country's future was in danger.

items.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party on course to win pivotal election mired in claims of Russian meddling
items.standfirst: Moldova's ruling PAS party pulled comfortably ahead of its Russian-leaning rivals in a high-stakes parliamentary election as final results trickled in on Monday, leaving the EU candidate country that borders Ukraine on track towards European integration. The tense vote was overshadowed by accusations of Russian interference in the former Soviet country.
items.content: Moldova's ruling PAS party pulled comfortably ahead of its Russian-leaning rivals in a high-stakes parliamentary election as final results trickled in on Monday, leaving the EU candidate country that borders Ukraine on track towards European integration. The tense vote was overshadowed by accusations of Russian interference in the former Soviet country.

items.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party takes lead in election as vote counting under way
items.standfirst: Moldovans await the results of a closely-watched parliamentary election, amid claims of Russian interference.
items.content: Moldovans await the results of a closely-watched parliamentary election, amid claims of Russian interference.

items.title: Moldova's pro EU party takes lead in parliamentary election
items.standfirst: Moldova's ruling Party of Action and Solidarity (PAS) pulled ahead in the country's closely watched parliamentary election, though it remains unclear whether it will be able to keep its absolu...
items.content: Moldova's ruling Party of Action and Solidarity (PAS) pulled ahead in the country's closely watched parliamentary election, though it remains unclear whether it will be able to keep its absolu...

items.title: Moldova's pro EU party takes the lead in parliamentary election
items.standfirst: More to come......
items.content: More to come......

items.title: Moldova’s Pro-Europe Ruling Party Leads in Early Election Count
Moldova’s pro-European party on course to retain majority in key election
items.standfirst: PAS leads with 46% of vote in ballot that will decide whether country steers closer to EU or RussiaMoldova’s ruling pro-European party is on course to retain its parliamentary majority after Sunday’s pivotal election, seen as a test of the president’s push to keep the country of 2.4 million on track for EU membership rather than drifting back towards Moscow.With more than 90% of the ballots counted, Maia Sandu’s pro-western Action and Solidarity party (PAS) led with 46% of the vote, while a Moscow-leaning alliance of Soviet-nostalgic parties headed by former president Igor Dodon had 27%. Continue reading...
items.content: PAS leads with 46% of vote in ballot that will decide whether country steers closer to EU or RussiaMoldova’s ruling pro-European party is on course to retain its parliamentary majority after Sunday’s pivotal election, seen as a test of the president’s push to keep the country of 2.4 million on track for EU membership rather than drifting back towards Moscow.With more than 90% of the ballots counted, Maia Sandu’s pro-western Action and Solidarity party (PAS) led with 46% of the vote, while a Moscow-leaning alliance of Soviet-nostalgic parties headed by former president Igor Dodon had 27%. Continue reading...

items.title: Moldova: bomb threats in polling stations abroad amid tense election
items.standfirst: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. The election was clouded by security incidents, including in polling stations abroad. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent Maria Gerth-Niculescu and analysis by the Romania editor of Radio France International (RFI), Ovidiu Nahol.
items.content: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. The election was clouded by security incidents, including in polling stations abroad. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent Maria Gerth-Niculescu and analysis by the Romania editor of Radio France International (RFI), Ovidiu Nahol.

items.title: Moldovans vote in a tense election plagued by Russian interference claims
items.standfirst: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affaires editor Philip Turle.
items.content: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affaires editor Philip Turle.

items.title: False bomb threats, security incidents cloud Moldova’s parliamentary vote
items.standfirst: Reporting from the Moldovan capital Chisinau, FRANCE 24’s Maria Gerth-Niculescu says there have been several security incidents on election day. False bomb threats briefly halted overseas voting in several EU cities on Sunday, according to Moldova’s foreign ministry, and cyberattacks targeted some official sites as the country voted in a tense parliamentary election.
items.content: Reporting from the Moldovan capital Chisinau, FRANCE 24’s Maria Gerth-Niculescu says there have been several security incidents on election day. False bomb threats briefly halted overseas voting in several EU cities on Sunday, according to Moldova’s foreign ministry, and cyberattacks targeted some official sites as the country voted in a tense parliamentary election.

items.title: Moldovans choose between pro-EU and pro-Russia camps in tense election
items.standfirst: Moldovans were voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday that could have a major impact on the government's quest to join the European Union, as a pro-Russian opposition group seeks to steer the nation away from closer ties with the bloc. As the poll was underway, a pro-Russian leader called for potential post-vote protests and cyber authorities reported that election infrastructure had been attacked over the past two days. Analysis by Jacques Rupnik, historian and emeritus director of research at Sciences Po Paris.
items.content: Moldovans were voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday that could have a major impact on the government's quest to join the European Union, as a pro-Russian opposition group seeks to steer the nation away from closer ties with the bloc. As the poll was underway, a pro-Russian leader called for potential post-vote protests and cyber authorities reported that election infrastructure had been attacked over the past two days. Analysis by Jacques Rupnik, historian and emeritus director of research at Sciences Po Paris.

items.title: "Moldova's European democratic future is dependent on having a pro-European government"
items.standfirst: Moldovans are heading to the polls to cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by Amy Eaglestone, lecturer at Leiden University.
items.content: Moldovans are heading to the polls to cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by Amy Eaglestone, lecturer at Leiden University.

items.title: Moldovans begin voting in tense election, torn between EU and Russia
items.standfirst: Moldovans began voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday that could have a major impact on the government's quest to join the European Union, as a popular pro-Russian group seeks to steer the small nation away from closer ties with the bloc. Story by Emily Boyle.
items.content: Moldovans began voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday that could have a major impact on the government's quest to join the European Union, as a popular pro-Russian group seeks to steer the small nation away from closer ties with the bloc. Story by Emily Boyle.

ai_summary: Moldova's ruling pro-EU party is leading in the election.
The election is seen as critical for Moldova's EU path.
Accusations of Russian interference have overshadowed the vote.
The party's lead is not yet enough for an absolute majority.
The election will determine if Moldova moves closer to the EU.

clusters.title: Denmark reports drone sightings again at several military locations
clusters.neutral_headline: Denmark Bans Drone Flights After Military Site Sightings

items.title: Denmark reports drone sightings again at several military locations
items.standfirst: Denmark's defense ministry reported more drone sightings overnight Saturday into Sunday at several of its armed forces' locations.
items.content: Denmark's defense ministry reported more drone sightings overnight Saturday into Sunday at several of its armed forces' locations.

items.title: Denmark bans civilian drone flights for EU summit after new sightings
items.standfirst: Denmark on Sunday ordered a ban on civilian drone flights in the coming week as a security measure ahead of an EU summit in Copenhagen. The ban came after mysterious drones were observed over Danish military sites overnight for a second straight day, raising concerns in northern Europe amid suspected Russian involvement.
items.content: Denmark on Sunday ordered a ban on civilian drone flights in the coming week as a security measure ahead of an EU summit in Copenhagen. The ban came after mysterious drones were observed over Danish military sites overnight for a second straight day, raising concerns in northern Europe amid suspected Russian involvement.

items.title: Denmark reports more drone sightings ahead of European summits
items.standfirst: Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Copenhagen prepares to host two European summits.The Danish defence ministry said on Sunday it had observed drones at several of its armed forces locations on Saturday night, without giving further details. The transport ministry said all civilian use of drones would be banned to ensure security while Denmark hosts an EU summit and a meeting of the European Political Community, a wider gathering of leaders from across the continent. Continue reading...
items.content: Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Copenhagen prepares to host two European summits.The Danish defence ministry said on Sunday it had observed drones at several of its armed forces locations on Saturday night, without giving further details. The transport ministry said all civilian use of drones would be banned to ensure security while Denmark hosts an EU summit and a meeting of the European Political Community, a wider gathering of leaders from across the continent. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark bans drone flights after latest drone sightings at military bases
items.standfirst: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.
items.content: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.

items.title: Denmark bans civil drones for a week after sightings over military bases
items.standfirst: Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders
items.content: Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders

ai_summary: Denmark reported more drone sightings at military locations.
Civilian drone flights will be banned for an EU summit.
The ban is a security measure ahead of the summit.
The sightings have raised concerns about Russian involvement.
The ban will last for the duration of the summit.

clusters.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forms in Atlantic, could threaten Southeast
clusters.neutral_headline: Tropical Storm Imelda Forms, Could Threaten Southeast US

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forms in Atlantic, could threaten Southeast
items.standfirst: Imelda is the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, and it could bring heavy rain to the U.S. coast from Florida to the Carolinas.
items.content: Imelda is the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, and it could bring heavy rain to the U.S. coast from Florida to the Carolinas.

items.title: Tropical Storm Conditions Expected Across Bahamas and Florida
items.standfirst: Tropical Storm Imelda moved over the Bahamas on Sunday, bringing heavy rain and tropical-storm-force winds to the region.
items.content: Tropical Storm Imelda moved over the Bahamas on Sunday, bringing heavy rain and tropical-storm-force winds to the region.

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forming and expected to become hurricane
items.standfirst: Forecast track could take storm, which caused disruption in Bahamas and Cuba, away from US east coastTropical Storm Imelda formed on Sunday and was expected to become a hurricane on a forecast track that could take it away from the US east coast in the coming days. The storm was causing disruption in the Bahamas and Cuba on Sunday, and a tropical storm watch was posted in parts of Florida.Meanwhile, Hurricane Humberto weakened very slightly but remained a strong category 4 storm in the Atlantic, threatening Bermuda. Continue reading...
items.content: Forecast track could take storm, which caused disruption in Bahamas and Cuba, away from US east coastTropical Storm Imelda formed on Sunday and was expected to become a hurricane on a forecast track that could take it away from the US east coast in the coming days. items.standfirst: US president reverses course days after scrapping meeting to discuss crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck SchumerDonald Trump has reversed course and is purportedly planning to host a bipartisan gathering of the top four US congressional leaders at the White House on Monday afternoon in a last-ditch effort to avoid a looming government shutdown, the House speaker and the US president’s fellow Republican Mike Johnson said on Sunday.Trump’s climbdown comes days after he scrapped a planned meeting to discuss the crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer, the respective Democratic minority leaders in the House and Senate.
